meanings.definition: To bring shame or disgrace upon
meanings.sent1: Cheating on a test dishonors the student's hard work.
meanings.sent2: His dishonest actions dishonored his family name.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox dishonors the honest rabbit in the story.
meanings.sent4: Breaking the rules dishonors the spirit of fair play.
meanings.sent5: The knight's betrayal dishonors his loyalty to the king.

meanings.sent1: Being accused of theft can lead to dishonors in the community.
meanings.sent2: The soldier felt the weight of dishonors after his mistake in battle.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to catch mice is a dishonors to its feline reputation.
meanings.sent4: The torn flag fluttering in the wind symbolized dishonors to the nation.
meanings.sent5: The broken trophy was a visible sign of dishonors in the competition.

meanings.definition: To fail to keep an agreement or promise
meanings.sent1: He dishonors his commitment by not showing up for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Breaking a pinky promise dishonors the bond of friendship.
meanings.sent3: The leaking roof dishonors the landlord's promise of a dry home.
meanings.sent4: Skipping class dishonors the student's pledge to attend all lectures.
meanings.sent5: The fading signature dishonors the artist's vow to always sign his work.
